CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Royal Academy?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Royal Academy is arc {Herman Research Center}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Herman Research Center?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Herman Research Center is arc {Royal Academy}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Odonnell Laboratory} has the largest output flow.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?
VPR.A: {Herman Research Center} has the largest input flow.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Herman Research Center to Odonnell Laboratory in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Herman Research Center to Royal Academy in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Royal Academy and Odonnell Laboratory in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Royal Academy and Odonnell Laboratory is {14}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Royal Academy and Herman Research Center in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Royal Academy and Herman Research Center is {15}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Royal Academy?
SC.A: The total flow output from Royal Academy is {29}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Royal Academy?
SC.A: The total flow input by Royal Academy is {36}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 29? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {30} from {Herman Research Center} to {Odonnell Laboratory}, a flow of {35} from {Odonnell Laboratory} to {Herman Research Center}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 14? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {7} from {Odonnell Laboratory} to {Royal Academy}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 10 and 29? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {14} from {Royal Academy} to {Odonnell Laboratory}, a flow of {29} from {Herman Research Center} to {Royal Academy}, a flow of {15} from {Royal Academy} to {Herman Research Center}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Herman Research Center to Royal Academy or from Herman Research Center to Odonnell Laboratory?
NC.A: The flow from {Herman Research Center} to {Odonnell Laboratory} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Herman Research Center to Royal Academy, from Royal Academy to Herman Research Center, or from Odonnell Laboratory to Herman Research Center?
NC.A: The flow from {Odonnell Laboratory} to {Herman Research Center} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Herman Research Center}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Herman Research Center} and {Odonnell Laboratory}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Royal Academy, Arc Herman Research Center, Arc Odonnell Laboratory}.
